p: It can be concluded that past refugia of D. involucrata were restricted to the same locations as contemporary populations (that is, in situ survival, as usually reported for plant species in subtropical China 58, especially the mountains in the Sichuan Basin and its adjacent areas 59). This would probably be true again in the future, although sizes might well be smaller. Being aware of the extent and locations of the future climate refugia of D. involucrata in China and the East Himalayan region will help us to implement effective conservation management.
